thread.title: 44 Lyons receive NEWMAC Fall All-Academic laurels - Mount Holyoke
thread.title_full: 44 Lyons receive NEWMAC Fall All-Academic laurels - Mount Holyoke

title: 44 Lyons receive NEWMAC Fall All-Academic laurels - Mount Holyoke
text:
WESTWOOD, Mass. -- Fourty-four fall student-athletes at Mount Holyoke College have been recognized by the New England Women's and Men's Athletic Conference (NEWMAC) for their dedication to athletics and academics and have been named to the Academic All-Conference team, released Dec. 4-5, 2024.
Honorees must have met the following criteria: earned a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5/4.0 scale or 4.35/5.0 scale at the conclusion of the spring 2024 semester, achieved second year academic status at their institution, and been a member of the varsity team for the entire semester.
Below are the student-athletes that were recognized for their impressive work:
Cross Country
- Kim Beaver
- Katie Earle
- Maya Evans
- Elizabeth Gerbi
- Tessa Lancaster
- Anjali Phadnis
- Greta Trapp
Field Hockey
- Linnea Alsted
- Emily Bisson
- Scout Climie
- Ainsley Gruener
- Lily Guerrera
- Sophia Guziewicz
- Mackenzie Hillman
- Rachel Katzenberg
- Kellyn Norman
- Alexina Peckinpaugh
- Ashley Scott
- Taylor Vettori
- Gracie Wilkinson
Soccer
- Annie Bethell
- Hannah Ellis
- Grace Baines
- Teya Broad-Wright
- Clarissa Govea
- Sage Hudson
- Anna Kennedy
- Hannah Keochakian
- Selma Keochakian
- Evie Krieg
- Avery Livingston
- Schuyler Pettibone
- Jenny Romero
- Taryn White
- Sydney Wiser
- Emma Zoubok
Volleyball
- Madeline Barton
- Lucie Berclaz
- Barah Burns
- Sadie Duffrin
- Serena Li
- Elle Rimando
- Amelia Ringor
- Kyra Staples
The NEWMAC is an association of 12 selective academic institutions: Babson College, Clark University, U.S Coast Guard Academy, Emerson College, Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Mount Holyoke College, Salve Regina University, Smith College, Springfield College, Wellesley College, Wheaton College, and Worcester Polytechnic Institute, that are committed to providing high quality competitive athletic opportunities for student-athletes within an educational and respectful environment that embodies the NCAA Division III Philosophy. The conference also partners with four Associate Members: Norwich University (Football), Simmons College (Rowing), SUNY Maritime College (Football), and U.S. Merchant Marine Academy (Football), while sponsoring 20 sports.
